comment: Extremely boring, excessive projects, and unpredictable test
Goes over all the information in class. Tests are multiple choice and he gives a small curve. The Quickbooks project was easy but time consuming. He will help you whenever you ask for it.

Really great teacher that wants to make sure that all his students pass. He doesn't just lecture so participation is key. One major Quickbooks project but it's really easy. He's a fairly lax grader when it comes to tests and will always answer questions. Very possible to get an A if you go to every class and do minimal studying.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Great professor.  Very helpful and cares about students.  Makes sure they understand material.  Available for extra help, when needed.  Listens and responds.  The Acct 2100 is the most w/d/f class but he works diligently with any student that requests it.

Do all of the homework and study and you'll do well. He really does care about his students and wants everyone to succeed. This class isn't easy in general no matter who you take, so if you want a professor that will give you all the time he can to explain something to you, I recommend him!
good and engaging enough lectures, straight forward tests and plenty of free grades through online homework and practice. nice dude, if you have to take accounting take him
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took the 4 week summer course for auditing (SO HARD). He is tough but fair. But if you're as far into accounting as I am, you will benefit from this course. He gives so many real life situations and applies all learning content to the stories.

Lets make this clear if you are looking for an easy professor to just pass the class do not take him. I really have to study for this class same as I did for a lower level accounting class which was 2100. If you are really an accounting major you should take him.

Hes a great professor for audit. hes knowledgeable and has interesting stories, but you do have to write a paper on them. There was 3 tests, 1 final, 1 paper, and 1 project. It was fairly straight forward and he was available to help. The tests can be tricky but nothing too impossible .
Just awful. Hilarious, but not on purpose.

Schafer's lectures were torture. He would rant about certain topics that were not on even mentioned on exams, which were made up of test bank questions. He is also quite arrogant, always talking about himself and making an assignment out of it. Auditing seems like an interesting subject, but he made it boring and painful. Would not recommend.
THE WORST PROFESSOR, Accounting or otherwise, that I have had at KSU.

Schafer was difficult. If this is you first accounting class, DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!! The entire semester I felt as if I was supposed to have taken another accounting class before 2100 because he taught the material in a way that seemed like I was supposed to know the information already. He did tutor me when I asked for it, but that still didn't help.

If this is your first accounting class please take someone else. Nice guy, very intelligent, but he doesn't know how to break down the material for beginners. He teaches the material as if you already know it. I was lost all semester. I failed every test even after studying, making flashcards, doing practice problems AND getting tutoring.

If you review slides discussed in previous class for 30 minutes a week, you'll do great. 2 tests, 1 final. Showing up helps bc he gives credit sometimes for people who come. Online HW is easy & on Internet, & it's worth a lot. The final is easy too. This isn't History, you can't learn it all b4 test. You should get at least a B, or an A if you try.

His goal is to ensure the value of a KSU business degree in the job market; therefore, he has high expectations for his students. He will review concepts the class is struggling with after doing the HW, however, if the class is unprepared, he will not review the concepts step-by-step. If you work hard and participate, you will succeed.

He isn't hard.  You have to study PPTs before class to keep up, but they cover everything that will be on test. He's given 5 pop quizzes worth nothing (2 points) and you get 1 point for attending. They average with 3 big quizzes. 2 medium-easy Tests, 1 Final, department made. HW is easy, online, & most answers are online.  STUDY and you'll get an A

Let me preface this by saying I HAVE A 4.0. Not anymore. His class will make you cry, angry, frustrated, overall want to kick your dog. 3 Tests. No curves. Sporadic attendancequizzes. Studying doesn't help, you'll still go into the test blindsided. Overall, just a mean guy waiting to get his paycheck and invest it in Kleenex. Hope he reads this.

This class was difficult and requires a lot of work and studying example problems. There are 4 tests and some pop quizzes. He doesn't take attendance, but unless you're there, you won't know how to do the problems. You have to study ALOT because the tests are crucial. He goes over the power points but its mostly self-taught through the book.

He seems like a great person, and he's probably a phenomenal accountant. But I literally cry over this class. This class is impossible. He expects us to do the homework before he teaches us. Our class average on the last test was 65. NO EXTRA CREDIT. No curves. Nothing gets drop. I have a 3.7 gpa.. Not after this class. (I'm current failing it)

This teacher is a horrible man who teaches like the student knows everything from the beginning. He is someone who makes their students cry and doesn't have any feelings towards them. If you ask for extra credit, he deducts points. If you never want your GPA to suffer, RUNNNNN!

Although Professor Shafer is a super interesting man, his teaching style was really hard for me to follow. He has you do the exercises as homework and then goes over them again in class. There is little to no explanation and he teaches as if you already have taken an accounting course. His tests are outrageously difficult even if you do study.

Accounting is already a very difficult subject for most people and he teaches as if you should already know everything. He expects you to read ahead for every class and work all the problems correctly before he even teaches the concepts. Tests are very difficult and you pretty much have to pray and know black magic to even think about passing.

Great person but not a great teacher .. He isn't very clear when explaining problems and examples to the class.  He knows what he's talking about but doesn't know how to break it down for students.  If you take this class be prepared to read each chapter word from word because there are pop quizzes almost every day.

Worst professor I have ever had. 2 tests and a final, and that's it. Online homework due every week, in class work that he expects you to do and know how to do it. Expects you to read a new chapter and know all of the material before you walk through the door. DONT TAKE HIM IF YOU WANT TO PASS. If you have no choice go to the tutors every day.

Get ready to dedicate your life to accounting. He expects you to understand every facet of this stuff but teaches it so nonchalantly like he expects you to already know it. You must read the chapters before class or you will be so lost. No extra credit, tests are IMPOSSIBLE (emphasis) seriously, stay away, i worked my butt of for a C
He is absolutely, by far, the worst professor I've ever had.

After taking his class I would not recommend him to anyone unless you're super smart. This is an INTRODUCTION class and he teaches like you should already know half of what he's talking about. He also goes really fast, so if you don't understand accounting you WILL get lost. Only 2 tests and the 3rd is the final. DONT TAKE

He is a great professor and knows his stuff. He teaches exactly what is on the test, but if you don't do the homework assignments you won't do well in this class. Occasionally you turn in the homework assignments and he won't notify you beforehand. 4 tests, weekly and daily homework. If you do all of the work you should make an A in this class.

took this class for summer 1, 4 weeks, its a lot of work and you are still expected to do the quickbooks project, along w/graded homework, and a manual accounting problem. there are 4 exams and a cumulative final. Read the chapters and stay up on the chapter readings.
just Keep up with the work and you will do fine. the class is easy but there is a huge project.
